comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: See www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2368281179/ for another photo on same occasion. At left is Mrs. Borden Harriman (known as Daisy). From NYT, query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9C04E3DA123CE633A..., on August 21, 1912, it appears that the Women's National Wilson and Marshall Organization (supporting Woodrow Wilson for President and led by Daisy Harriman) kicked off its campaign efforts in Union Square on August 20. Among the speakers was Mrs. S.A. Vibbert, who was 75.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Another Bain/LOC photo of Mrs. Vibbirt, of the Woman's National Wilson and Marshall Organization, addressing a political rally in New York's Union Square, August 20, 1912:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3276245169/]

Daisy Harriman tosses the contents of a box of campaign buttons at the crowd:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2368281179/]

Boys in the Union Square crowd grab for the buttons, almost starting a riot:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2369111942/]
